All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Ability
This class is used as means of giving an Enemy object an alternative option other than a melee attack.
Ally
A class to be used in a NonCombatEncounter.
Closeable<T>
An interface intended to ensure that a game interface always has a method of elegantly closing on command.
CombatEncounter
 
Encounter
 
EncounterController
A class intended to be used to control how the framework responds to certain player behaviours, interactions, and input.
EncounterPattern
These are the current encounter patterns available.
Encounters
 
EncounterTraversalController
A class that handles the transition between one encounter to another.
Enemy
A class intended to be used in a CombatEncounter.
Feat
This class is used by both the Player and the Encounter classes to add functionality that allow a developer to add feat checks and rewards to their own game permutation.
FixedEncounters
A class that allows the developer to manually control encounter order and traversal paths that will appear in a single game's permutation.
GameEngine
A class intended to hold all required elements of an executable game.
GameInterface
An abstract class intended to be used to render the game in a desired interface.
GamePlatform
These are the current interfaces that the game can be played in.
GameSettings
A class intended to hold preferences and settings stipulating how the game renders.
InvalidValueException
A custom exception class that is intended to be used for input validation before compile time to ensure that all objects are created with no unintended effects (such as a zero value being given, and then being passed to a multiplication operator).
InventoryFullException
A custom exception class intended to be used when an Item object is added to the player's inventory.
Item
A class used to model items that can be stored in a player's inventory, dropped by an enemy, or sold by an ally.
NonCombatEncounter
 
NonPlayableCharacter
 
Player
A class that models a player's player character.
ProbabilityCalculator<T>
A class intended to be used as a means to calculate both weighted and non-weighted probabilities, and to return a generic object based on the objects, together with their probabilities, that have been supplied.
Prop
This class is used to add props that can be interacted with (using the 'investigate' command) during runtime in an Encounter.
RandomEncounters
A class that includes an encounter pool and an integer that states how many encounters are to be chosen from said encounter pool to be included in a single game's permutation.
StringParser
A class intended to parse a string (in the case of this framework, the string that is taken as user input), and determining if it is a valid command, or a valid combination of a verb and a noun.
Swing
An class intended to be used to render the game in a Java Swing window.
Terminal
An class intended to be used to render the game in a terminal window.
Useable
A functional interface intended to be used as a way for a developer to pass custom method behaviours while also remaining serialisable.
